chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

V: NormedModule K

F: (U -> Prop) -> Prop

g: U -> V
f: U -> V

Goal:
F (fun y : U => f y = g y) -> (forall x : U, is_filter_lim F x -> f x = g x) -> ex_filterdiff f F -> ex_filterdiff g F

Premises:

ex_filterdiff = fun (f : U -> V) (F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) => exists l : U -> V, filterdiff f F l : (U -> V) -> ((U -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope]
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule.type
ex_filterdiff_locally = fun (F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) (FF : ProperFilter F) (f : U -> V) (x : U) (Fx : is_filter_lim F x) (H : ex_filterdiff f (locally x)) => match H with | @ex_intro _ _ l Df => ex_intro (fun l0 : U -> V => filterdiff f F l0) l (filterdiff_locally f x l Fx Df) end : forall F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop, ProperFilter F -> forall (f : U -> V) (x : U), is_filter_lim F x -> ex_filterdiff f (locally x) -> ex_filterdiff f F Arguments F, FF are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [function_scope _ function_scope _ _ _]

continuous_scal_l : forall (f0 : ?U -> ?K) (k : ?V) (x : ?U), continuous f0 x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => scal (f0 y) k) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- NormedModule ?K]

is_filter_lim_filter_le : forall x : ?T, filter_le ?G ?F -> is_filter_lim ?F x -> is_filter_lim ?G x where ?T : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- UniformSpace] ?F : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?G : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop]
equiv_carac_0 : forall f0 g0 : ?T -> ?V, is_equiv ?F f0 g0 -> {o : ?T -> ?V | (forall x : ?T, f0 x = plus (g0 x) (o x)) /\ is_domin ?F g0 o} where ?T : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- Type] ?K : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U ->...-> V |- Filter ?F]

is_filter_lim_filtermap : forall (F0 : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop) (x : ?T) (f0 : ?T -> ?U), filterlim f0 (locally x) (locally (f0 x)) -> is_filter_lim F0 x -> is_filter_lim (filtermap f0 F0) (f0 x) where ?T : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- UniformSpace] ?U : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- UniformSpace]
norm_triangle_inv : forall x y : ?V, Rabs (norm x - norm y) <= norm (minus x y) where ?K : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing U : NormedModule K V : NormedModule K F : (U -> Prop) -> Prop FF : Filter F f : U -> V g : U -> V |- NormedModule ?K]

original: intros Hfg Hf_exfdiff Hg_exfdiff. assert (Hf_eq_g : forall x : U, is_filter_lim F x -> f x = g x). { intros x Hx. apply Hfg. apply Hf_exfdiff. } assert (Hfg_filter : F (fun y : U => f y = g y)). { apply filterdiff_ext_loc with (f := f) (g := g). auto. } assert (Hg_exfdiff_loc : ex_filterdiff g (locally x)). { apply ex_filterdiff_locally with (F := F) (FF := FF) (f := g) (x := x) (Fx := Hx). auto. } assert (Hfg_continuous : continuous f x). { apply filterdiff_continuous with (f := f) (x := x) (H := Hf_exfdiff). auto. } assert (Hg_continuous : continuous g x). { apply filterdiff_continuous with (f := g) (x := x) (H := Hg_exfdiff_loc). auto. } assert (Hfg_equiv : is_equiv F f g). { apply equiv_ext_loc with (f0 := f) (g0 := g). auto. } assert (Hfg_filterlim : filterlim f F (locally x)). { apply filterlim_ext with (f0 := f) (g0 := g) (F := F) (G := locally x). auto. } assert (Hg_filterlim : filterlim g F (locally x)). { apply filterlim_ext with (f0 := g) (g0 := f) (F := F) (G := locally x). auto. } apply ex_filterdiff_ext with (f0 := f) (g0 := g) (F := F). auto.
